availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Robertson Bacon (Franklin County, Kentucky, carpenter)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Married to Judith Ann Bacon. Father of Anne C. Bacon, Belle Bacon, Sallie Bacon, and Harry Bacon. Carpenter in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Carpenter in Franklin County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Household owned an additional five enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 43B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 389.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 501A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 153B.
